intro: Sabia parviflora var. harmandiana, commonly known as the Harmand's small-flowered sabia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, pale yellow flowers and hairy, ovate leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
